meanings.definition: The act of submerging or being submerged in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The submersion of the toy boat in the bathtub was fun.
meanings.sent2: The diver experienced submersion in the deep ocean.
meanings.sent3: The submersion of the sandwich in the soup made for a soggy lunch.
meanings.sent4: Her submersion in books took her to far-off lands without leaving her room.
meanings.sent5: The submersion of the sun below the horizon marked the end of the day.

meanings.definition: The state of being completely covered or hidden beneath something.
meanings.sent1: The submersion of the treasure chest in the sand kept it hidden.
meanings.sent2: The submersion of the city in snow created a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent3: The submersion of the cat under the blankets made it purr contentedly.
meanings.sent4: His submersion in work left him with little time for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The submersion of the moon behind the clouds darkened the night sky.

meanings.definition: The process of immersing something in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The submersion of the tea bag in hot water created a soothing drink.
meanings.sent2: The submersion of the paintbrush in water cleaned off the paint.
meanings.sent3: The submersion of the cookie in milk made it soft and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The submersion of the key in oil loosened the rusty lock.
meanings.sent5: The submersion of the seed in soil marked the beginning of growth.
